title: Hydroponics 101: What we grow | CropKing Inc.

tasks.task: Visiting a hydroponic farm and learning about crop variety
subtasks: Arriving at the Experimental Greenhouse at Crop King in Lodi, Ohio
Discussing the hydroponic process and its applications
Exploring different crops grown hydroponically, such as lettuce, tomatoes, melons, and cucumbers
Describing the nutrient film technique (NFT) system used for leafy greens
Discussing the Dutch bucket system (Beto system) used for vine crops
Observing the controlled environment of the greenhouse, including artificial lighting and temperature regulation
Explaining pollination methods in hydroponic environments, such as using bumblebees or vibration tools
Demonstrating the use of a Veggie Bee pollination device

tasks.task: Touring the Crop King tomato house
subtasks: Observing the growth of tomatoes, their support systems, and the controlled environment
Noting the presence of other vine crops like melons and cucumbers in the greenhouse

tasks.task: Exploring hydroponic farming methods and their benefits
subtasks: Highlighting the ability to grow a wide variety of crops year-round
Emphasizing the importance of pollination techniques in hydroponic systems
Mentioning safety considerations, such as avoiding bee pollination in certain settings
Encouraging viewers to try hydroponic gardening and experiment with different crops
